When my depression works the graveyard shift, all of the people	In the shoes I gave you as a present	Every single thing I touch becomes sick with sadness	Dear reader, get out your map	Depending on what kind of mood and situationship I'm in	I didn't know you were keeping count	You're terrified to look down	Breathe in, breathe through, breathe deep, breathe out	[Verse 1]	'Cause we lost track of time again	You and I ended up in the same room	He wanted a bride, I was making my own name	Turns out, it was that guy you hooked up with ages ago	[Verse 1]	But it might just have been you	A pebble that we picked up last July	Spineless in my tomb of silence	Sometimes I wonder which one'll be your last lie	If you tasted poison, you could've	I wait patiently, he's gonna notice me
I've ghosted stand there in the room	Puttin' someone first only works when you're in their top five	'Cause it's all over now, all out to sea	Pick somewhere and just run	And what's in my system	Rain soaking, blind hoping	'Cause if you dare, you'll see the glare	I'll be gettin' over you my whole life	Staring at the ceiling with you	Laughing with my feet in your lap	At the same time	Chasing that fame, he stayed the same	Some wannabe Z-lister	Good girl, sad boy	Passing by unbeknownst to me	Down deep inside your pocket	Tore your banners down, took the battle underground	They say looks can kill and I might try	Spit me out at the first chance	It's okay, we're the best of friends
